30 // XXX:
31 // Only compile these tests if 'float' and 'double' are IEEE-754 single- and
32 // double-precision numbers, resp.
33 
34 #include "doctest_compatibility.h"
35 
36 #include <nlohmann/json.hpp>
37 using nlohmann::detail::dtoa_impl::reinterpret_bits;
38 
39 namespace
40 {
41 static float make_float(uint32_t sign_bit, uint32_t biased_exponent, uint32_t significand)
42 {
43  assert(sign_bit == 0 || sign_bit == 1);
44  assert(biased_exponent <= 0xFF);
45  assert(significand <= 0x007FFFFF);
46 
47  uint32_t bits = 0;
48 
49  bits |= sign_bit << 31;
50  bits |= biased_exponent << 23;
51  bits |= significand;
52 
53  return reinterpret_bits<float>(bits);
54 }
55 
56 // ldexp -- convert f * 2^e to IEEE single precision
57 static float make_float(uint64_t f, int e)
58 {
59  constexpr uint64_t kHiddenBit = 0x00800000;
60  constexpr uint64_t kSignificandMask = 0x007FFFFF;
61  constexpr int kPhysicalSignificandSize = 23; // Excludes the hidden bit.
62  constexpr int kExponentBias = 0x7F + kPhysicalSignificandSize;
63  constexpr int kDenormalExponent = 1 - kExponentBias;
64  constexpr int kMaxExponent = 0xFF - kExponentBias;
65 
66  while (f > kHiddenBit + kSignificandMask)
67  {
68  f >>= 1;
69  e++;
70  }
71  if (e >= kMaxExponent)
72  {
73  return std::numeric_limits<float>::infinity();
74  }
75  if (e < kDenormalExponent)
76  {
77  return 0.0;
78  }
79  while (e > kDenormalExponent && (f & kHiddenBit) == 0)
80  {
81  f <<= 1;
82  e--;
83  }
84 
85  uint64_t biased_exponent = (e == kDenormalExponent && (f & kHiddenBit) == 0)
86  ? 0
87  : static_cast<uint64_t>(e + kExponentBias);
88 
89  uint64_t bits = (f & kSignificandMask) | (biased_exponent << kPhysicalSignificandSize);
90  return reinterpret_bits<float>(static_cast<uint32_t>(bits));
91 }
92 
93 static double make_double(uint64_t sign_bit, uint64_t biased_exponent, uint64_t significand)
94 {
95  assert(sign_bit == 0 || sign_bit == 1);
96  assert(biased_exponent <= 0x7FF);
97  assert(significand <= 0x000FFFFFFFFFFFFF);
98 
99  uint64_t bits = 0;
100 
101  bits |= sign_bit << 63;
102  bits |= biased_exponent << 52;
103  bits |= significand;
104 
105  return reinterpret_bits<double>(bits);
106 }
107 
108 // ldexp -- convert f * 2^e to IEEE double precision
109 static double make_double(uint64_t f, int e)
110 {
111  constexpr uint64_t kHiddenBit = 0x0010000000000000;
112  constexpr uint64_t kSignificandMask = 0x000FFFFFFFFFFFFF;
113  constexpr int kPhysicalSignificandSize = 52; // Excludes the hidden bit.
114  constexpr int kExponentBias = 0x3FF + kPhysicalSignificandSize;
115  constexpr int kDenormalExponent = 1 - kExponentBias;
116  constexpr int kMaxExponent = 0x7FF - kExponentBias;
117 
118  while (f > kHiddenBit + kSignificandMask)
119  {
120  f >>= 1;
121  e++;
122  }
123  if (e >= kMaxExponent)
124  {
125  return std::numeric_limits<double>::infinity();
126  }
127  if (e < kDenormalExponent)
128  {
129  return 0.0;
130  }
131  while (e > kDenormalExponent && (f & kHiddenBit) == 0)
132  {
133  f <<= 1;
134  e--;
135  }
136 
137  uint64_t biased_exponent = (e == kDenormalExponent && (f & kHiddenBit) == 0)
138  ? 0
139  : static_cast<uint64_t>(e + kExponentBias);
140 
141  uint64_t bits = (f & kSignificandMask) | (biased_exponent << kPhysicalSignificandSize);
142  return reinterpret_bits<double>(bits);
143 }
144 }
145 
146 TEST_CASE("digit gen")
147 {
148  SECTION("single precision")
149  {
150  auto check_float = [](float number, const std::string & digits, int expected_exponent)
151  {
152  CAPTURE(number)
153  CAPTURE(digits)
154  CAPTURE(expected_exponent)
155 
156  char buf[32];
157  int len = 0;
158  int exponent = 0;
159  nlohmann::detail::dtoa_impl::grisu2(buf, len, exponent, number);
160 
161  CHECK(digits == std::string(buf, buf + len));
162  CHECK(expected_exponent == exponent);
163  };
164 
165  check_float(make_float(0, 0, 0x00000001), "1", -45); // min denormal
166  check_float(make_float(0, 0, 0x007FFFFF), "11754942", -45); // max denormal
167  check_float(make_float(0, 1, 0x00000000), "11754944", -45); // min normal
168  check_float(make_float(0, 1, 0x00000001), "11754945", -45);
169  check_float(make_float(0, 1, 0x007FFFFF), "23509886", -45);
170  check_float(make_float(0, 2, 0x00000000), "23509887", -45);
171  check_float(make_float(0, 2, 0x00000001), "2350989", -44);
172  check_float(make_float(0, 24, 0x00000000), "98607613", -39); // fail if no special case in normalized boundaries
173  check_float(make_float(0, 30, 0x00000000), "63108872", -37); // fail if no special case in normalized boundaries
174  check_float(make_float(0, 31, 0x00000000), "12621775", -36); // fail if no special case in normalized boundaries
175  check_float(make_float(0, 57, 0x00000000), "84703295", -29); // fail if no special case in normalized boundaries
176  check_float(make_float(0, 254, 0x007FFFFE), "34028233", 31);
177  check_float(make_float(0, 254, 0x007FFFFF), "34028235", 31); // max normal
178 
179  // V. Paxson and W. Kahan, "A Program for Testing IEEE Binary-Decimal Conversion", manuscript, May 1991,
180  // ftp://ftp.ee.lbl.gov/testbase-report.ps.Z (report)
181  // ftp://ftp.ee.lbl.gov/testbase.tar.Z (program)
182 
183  // Table 16: Stress Inputs for Converting 24-bit Binary to Decimal, < 1/2 ULP
184  check_float(make_float(12676506, -102), "25", -25);
185  check_float(make_float(12676506, -103), "125", -26);
186  check_float(make_float(15445013, 86), "1195", 30);
187  check_float(make_float(13734123, -138), "39415", -39);
188  check_float(make_float(12428269, -130), "913085", -38);
189  check_float(make_float(15334037, -146), "1719005", -43);
190  check_float(make_float(11518287, -41), "52379105", -13);
191  check_float(make_float(12584953, -145), "2821644", -43);
192  check_float(make_float(15961084, -125), "37524328", -38);
193  check_float(make_float(14915817, -146), "16721209", -44);
194  check_float(make_float(10845484, -102), "21388946", -31);
195  check_float(make_float(16431059, -61), "7125836", -18);
196 
197  // Table 17: Stress Inputs for Converting 24-bit Binary to Decimal, > 1/2 ULP
198  check_float(make_float(16093626, 69), "95", 26);
199  check_float(make_float( 9983778, 25), "335", 12);
200  check_float(make_float(12745034, 104), "2585", 35);
201  check_float(make_float(12706553, 72), "60005", 24);
202  check_float(make_float(11005028, 45), "387205", 15);
203  check_float(make_float(15059547, 71), "3555835", 22);
204  check_float(make_float(16015691, -99), "25268305", -30);
205  check_float(make_float( 8667859, 56), "6245851", 17);
206  check_float(make_float(14855922, -82), "30721327", -25);
207  check_float(make_float(14855922, -83), "15360663", -25);
208  check_float(make_float(10144164, -110), "781478", -32);
209  check_float(make_float(13248074, 95), "52481028", 28);
210  }

212  SECTION("double precision")
213  {
214  auto check_double = [](double number, const std::string & digits, int expected_exponent)
215  {
216  CAPTURE(number)
217  CAPTURE(digits)
218  CAPTURE(expected_exponent)
219 
220  char buf[32];
221  int len = 0;
222  int exponent = 0;
223  nlohmann::detail::dtoa_impl::grisu2(buf, len, exponent, number);
224 
225  CHECK(digits == std::string(buf, buf + len));
226  CHECK(expected_exponent == exponent);
227  };
228 
229  check_double(make_double(0, 0, 0x0000000000000001), "5", -324); // min denormal
230  check_double(make_double(0, 0, 0x000FFFFFFFFFFFFF), "2225073858507201", -323); // max denormal
231  check_double(make_double(0, 1, 0x0000000000000000), "22250738585072014", -324); // min normal
232  check_double(make_double(0, 1, 0x0000000000000001), "2225073858507202", -323);
233  check_double(make_double(0, 1, 0x000FFFFFFFFFFFFF), "44501477170144023", -324);
234  check_double(make_double(0, 2, 0x0000000000000000), "4450147717014403", -323);
235  check_double(make_double(0, 2, 0x0000000000000001), "4450147717014404", -323);
236  check_double(make_double(0, 4, 0x0000000000000000), "17800590868057611", -323); // fail if no special case in normalized boundaries
237  check_double(make_double(0, 5, 0x0000000000000000), "35601181736115222", -323); // fail if no special case in normalized boundaries
238  check_double(make_double(0, 6, 0x0000000000000000), "7120236347223045", -322); // fail if no special case in normalized boundaries
239  check_double(make_double(0, 10, 0x0000000000000000), "11392378155556871", -321); // fail if no special case in normalized boundaries
240  check_double(make_double(0, 2046, 0x000FFFFFFFFFFFFE), "17976931348623155", 292);
241  check_double(make_double(0, 2046, 0x000FFFFFFFFFFFFF), "17976931348623157", 292); // max normal
242 
243  // Test different paths in DigitGen
244  check_double( 10000, "1", 4);
245  check_double( 1200000, "12", 5);
246  check_double(4.9406564584124654e-324, "5", -324); // exit integral loop
247  check_double(2.2250738585072009e-308, "2225073858507201", -323); // exit fractional loop
248  check_double( 1.82877982605164e-99, "182877982605164", -113);
249  check_double( 1.1505466208671903e-09, "11505466208671903", -25);
250  check_double( 5.5645893133766722e+20, "5564589313376672", 5);
251  check_double( 53.034830388866226, "53034830388866226", -15);
252  check_double( 0.0021066531670178605, "21066531670178605", -19);
253

356 TEST_CASE("formatting")
357 {
358  SECTION("single precision")
359  {
360  auto check_float = [](float number, const std::string & expected)
361  {
362  char buf[32];
363  char* end = nlohmann::detail::to_chars(buf, buf + 32, number);
364  std::string actual(buf, end);
365 
366  CHECK(actual == expected);
367  };
368  // %.9g
369  check_float( -1.2345e-22f, "-1.2345e-22" ); // -1.23450004e-22
370  check_float( -1.2345e-21f, "-1.2345e-21" ); // -1.23450002e-21

478  SECTION("integer")
479  {
480  auto check_integer = [](std::int64_t number, const std::string & expected)
481  {
482  nlohmann::json j = number;
483  CHECK(j.dump() == expected);
484  };
485 
486  // edge cases
487  check_integer(INT64_MIN, "-9223372036854775808");
488  check_integer(INT64_MAX, "9223372036854775807");
